choices.C: Yes, but only from global scope to private scope

questions.question_text: Is it possible to change an application’s scope?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Per course documentation: It is not possible to change an application's scope once the record is saved to the database.

Yes, it is possible to change an application's scope in ServiceNow, although it's typically done by modifying the "sys_scope" field of a record through scripting or directly in the database, effectively assigning the record to a different application scope; this is not a simple UI-based change and requires careful consideration to avoid data inconsistencies.
I think the answer is B

To convert your solution from a global scoped application to a unique scope, you will need to recreate your application and move the logic over manually

So Answer is A (No)

Selected Answer: A
Option A, no its not possible

questions.question_text: Which of the following is true about g_scratchpad? (Choose two.)

choices.D: Has default properties passed by client-side scripts
choices.B: Does not exist on the mobile platform
choices.A: Used to push information from the server to the client

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
The g_scratchpad object has no default properties, constructors or methods. https://developer.servicenow.com/dev.do#!/learn/courses/washingtondc/app_store_learnv2_scripting_washingtondc_scripting_in_servicenow/app_store_learnv2_scripting_washingtondc_server_side_scripting/app_store_learnv2_scripting_washingtondc_controlling_when_business_rules_run
AB for the reasons already cited.

Answer AB: CAD book.
The g_scratchpad object does not exist on the mobile platform.

Selected Answer: AD
Answer is AD
